dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That cold air shifting eastward from northern Kazakhstan... I just don't see how temperatures are supposed to drop that much after rainfall.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That cold air shifting eastward from northern Kazakhstan... I just don't see how temperatures are supposed to drop that much after rainfall.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Cold air that affected the northern part of the country in recent days will begin shifting eastward. Following the rainfall, temperatures are expected to drop, with nighttime frosts possible in some areas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the meteorologists at Kazhydromet are saying nighttime frosts are actually possible in some areas, which is pretty wild for late May.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the meteorologists at Kazhydromet are saying nighttime frosts are actually possible in some areas, which is pretty wild for late May.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Meteorologists at Kazhydromet have shared the weather forecast for May 27, 28, and 29 in Kazakhstan. Following the rainfall, temperatures are expected to drop, with nighttime frosts possible in some areas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But then they mention daytime temps hitting 20 to 25 degrees—that's not exactly cold.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then they mention daytime temps hitting twenty to twenty five degrees-that's not exactly cold.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Cool nights will persist, while daytime temperatures will range from +20 to +25ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, but that northwestern anticyclone is blocking a real warm-up. It's feeding on cold air masses, so it's kind of holding things back.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, but that northwestern anticyclone is blocking a real warm-up. It's feeding on cold air masses, so it's kind of holding things back.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, a northwestern anticyclone, fed by cold air masses, will prevent a sharp rise in temperatures.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile the south and west are getting summer heat—up to 35 degrees by the 29th? That's a huge swing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile the south and west are getting summer heat-up to thirty five degrees by the twenty ninth? That's a huge swing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Residents of southern and western regions will feel the arrival of summer. According to the forecast, daytime temperatures in these areas will rise to +30¦+35ÂC on May 29.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's like two different seasons happening at once. Minister Nysanbayev even warned about the southwest possibly hitting 45 degrees later in the summer.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's like two different seasons happening at once. Minister Nysanbayev even warned about the southwest possibly hitting forty five degrees later in the summer.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, Minister of Ecology and Natural Resources Yerlan Nysanbayev shared the weather forecast for the upcoming summer in Kazakhstan. In some parts of the southwest, temperatures could reach 45ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: 45? Seriously? And they think rainfall will be normal? I feel like these forecasts always underestimate drought risk.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: forty five? Seriously? And they think rainfall will be normal? I feel like these forecasts always underestimate drought risk.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rainfall in June and July is expected to be within normal levels, though the north, south, and southeast may receive slightly more.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: They did say the north and south might get a bit more rain in June and July, but August and September could be drier than usual.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They did say the north and south might get a bit more rain in June and July, but August and September could be drier than usual.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rainfall in June and July is expected to be within normal levels, though the north, south, and southeast may receive slightly more. In August and September, less rainfall is expected, and temperatures may be about 1ÂC above normal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Plus that one-degree-above-normal temp for late summer… might not sound like much, but it adds up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus that one-degree-above-normal temp for late summer... might not sound like much, but it adds up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In August and September, less rainfall is expected, and temperatures may be about 1ÂC above normal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And you know, they're calling it preliminary—so things could definitely shift.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And you know, they're calling it preliminary-so things could definitely shift.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This forecast is preliminary and subject to change.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Still, frost in late May… I'd be covering my garden if I lived up north.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, frost in late May... I'd be covering my garden if I lived up north.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Better safe than sorry with those kinds of dips.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Better safe than sorry with those kinds of dips.
